{{Bare URLs|date=January 2013}} {{Infobox software | name = Strigi | logo = [[Image:Strigi icon.svg|70px]] | screenshot = | caption = | collapsible = | author = | developer = Jos van den Oever
Flavio Castelli | released = | latest release version = 0.7.7[https://projects.kde.org/projects/kdesupport/strigi/strigi/repository/revisions/28a7df0d99f8fde1c8c9f5868cbd7f9a278c4655/entry/ChangeLog ChangeLog] | latest release date = {{Start date and age|2011|12|07}} | latest preview version = | latest preview date = | frequently updated = | programming language = [[C++]] | operating system = Linux | size = | language = | status = Activehttp://sourceforge.net/projects/strigi | genre = [[Desktop search|Search tool]] | license = [[LGPL]] | website = {{URL|http://sourceforge.net/projects/strigi}} }} '''Strigi''' is a [[desktop search]] [[Daemon (computer software)|daemon]], which is [[operating system]]-independent and [[desktop environment|desktop]]-independent. Strigi was initiated by [[Jos van den Oever]]. Strigi's goals are to be fast, use a small amount of [[Random access memory|RAM]], and use flexible [[backend]]s and [[plug-in (computing)|plug-in]]s.[http://strigi.sourceforge.net/?q=features Strigi's features] A benchmark as of January 2007 showed that Strigi is faster and uses less memory than other search systems,[http://kdedevelopers.org/node/2639 Benchmark between Beagle, JIndex, Tracker and Strigi] 01-17-2007 but it lacks many of their features{{Citation needed|date=May 2009}}. Like most desktop search systems, Strigi can extract information from files, such as the length of an audio clip, the contents of a document, or the resolution of a picture; plugins determine what filetypes it is capable of handling.http://www.linux.com/feature/126312 Strigi uses its own Jstream system which allows for [[deep indexing]] of files. Strigi is accessible via [[Konqueror]], or by clicking on its [[icon (computing)|icon]], after adding it to [[KDE]]'s [[Kicker (KDE)|Kicker]] or [[GNOME Panel]]. (In [[GNOME]] desktop, it is called the [[OpenTracker|Deskbar]] applet.) The [[graphical user interface]] (GUI) is named Strigiclient. ==Features== * [[SHA-1]] hash for every file indexed to find duplicates * As of July, 2007 Strigi supports indexing the contents of [[plain text]], [[PDF]], [[MP3]], archives, [[Debian]] and [[RPM]] packages, and OASIS [[OpenDocument]] text (odt), spreadsheet (ods) and presentation (odp) files * [[D-Bus]] and socket support for communication between the daemon and search program * Small memory footprint * [[Xesam]] query language support * Very portable, currently runs on Linux, Solaris, FreeBSD,http://www.freebsd.org/cgi/ports.cgi?query=Strigi&stype=all Mac OS X and Windows * Pluggable backend: [[Lucene]] and [[HyperEstraier]], [[SQLite]] and [[Xapian]] backends are being worked on * [[inotify]] and synchronization to filesystem are being attempted. * Strigi's indexing can be stopped manually, and will suspend itself if running on a laptop's batteries, disk drive runs out of space,http://www.kdedevelopers.org/node/3573 and/or runs in the background until the [[CPU]] is not busy with tasks that the computer-user is waiting on the CPU for. ==Operating systems and desktops== [[KDE Plasma Workspaces]] require Strigi as core component of the new [[semantic desktop]] technologies. Strigi and [[NEPOMUK (framework)|NEPOMUK]] are working together to help create a [[semantic desktop]] search. NEPOMUK will allow the user to add metadata, which Strigi will be able to index for a more precise search. Developers are also considering adding [[Sonnet (KDE)|Sonnet]] support to Strigi to allow users to search for documents written in a specific language.[http://www.linux.com/articles/59963 Linux.com: KDE 4's Sonnet will turbocharge language processing] [[GNOME]] has an optional applet to search for files using Strigi, named Deskbar.[http://packages.debian.org/unstable/gnome/deskbar-plugins-strigi Debian - Details of package deskbar-plugins-strigi in sid] Deskbar is included in the GNOME desktop of [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] 8.10, for example. ==See also== {{Portal|Free software}} * [[List of search engines#Desktop search engines|List of desktop search engines]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://strigi.sourceforge.net/ Strigi home page] * [http://www.vandenoever.info/software/strigi/ Jos van den Oever's own Strigi page] * [http://dot.kde.org/1176310483/ KDE dot article on Strigi in KDE 4] * [http://www.wikinfo.org/index.php/Comparison_of_desktop_search_software Comparison of desktop search software] {{KDE}} {{Navigationbox Desktopsearch}} [[Category:Desktop search engines]] [[Category:Free software programmed in C++]]
